column12: A METHOD OF PRODUCING GRAPHENE REINFORCED METAL COMPOSITE
column13: The present invention relates to a method of producing a grafted graphene reinforced copper composite comprising the steps of dispersing copper oxide-grafted graphene nanoplatelets in a first binding solution which comprises paraffin wax and n-heptane to form a suspension; mixing the suspension homogenously with copper powder to form a composite slurry; drying the composite slurry to remove n-heptane therefrom; further mixing the dried composite particles with second stage binding elements which comprise stearic acid and high-density polyethylene; and subjecting the mixture to powder injection molding to form the grafted graphene reinforced-copper composite. (The Most Illustrative Drawing: Figure 1.)
column14: INSTITUTE OF TECH PETRONAS SDN BHD
column15: FAIZ AHMAD;;ABQAAT NASEER

column12: NEW INTUMESCENT FIRE RETARDANT COATING
column13: The present invention relates to an intumescent fire retardant coating which is in the form of liquid and cures a solidified and adheres to a substrate. Particularly, the coating includes expandable graphite, ammonium poly phosphate, melamine, boric acid, a thermosetting epoxy resin, like as bisphenol A epoxy resin BE 188 (BPA) is used as a binder with ACR Hardener H- 2310 polyamide amine, MWCNTs , kaolin clay and zirconium silicate. Further, in the presence of the fire or heat an intumescent layer develop at the surface of coated substrate. The coating material having intumescent characteristic provides heat resistant and fire retardant, corrosion resistant and water proof properties to insulate the substrate.
column15: FAIZ AHMAD;;SAMI ULLAH

column12: NETWORK NODE AND METHOD IN A WIRELESS COMMUNICATIONS NETWORK
column13: A method performed by a first network node for selecting a secondary cell for a first wireless device is provided. The first network node configures the first wireless device with a first threshold value relating to a signal quality for determining whether any secondary cell candidate(s) shall be reported to the first network node. The first network node receives a first report comprising a signal quality for secondary cell candidate whose measured signal quality meets the first threshold value. The first network node selects a first secondary cell candidate. The first network node instructs the first wireless device to attach to the first secondary cell candidate. The first network node detects that the first wireless device has failed a first series of random access attempts to the first secondary cell candidate. The first network node configures the first wireless device with a better second threshold value.
column15: GHOSH INDRANIL;;KHAN FAIZ AHMAD

column12: PROCESS OF PRODUCING NANOCOMPOSITE FEEDSTOCK FOR HEAT DISSIPATERS FOR ELECTRONIC SYSTEMS
column13: A PROCESS OF PREPARING FEEDSTOCK FOR METAL INJECTION MOLDING (MIM) TECHNIQUE FOR REINFORCING ADVANCED COMPOSITES ON A METAL FOR PREPARING HEAT SINKS IS PROVIDE. THE PROCESS INCLUDES PREPARING A MIXTURE OF ADVANCED COMPOSITE PARAFFIN WAX; HOMOGENIZING THE MIXTURE TO OBTAIN HOMOGENIZED MIXTURE; DRYING THE HOMOGENIZED MIXTURE TO OBTAIN DRIED MIXTURE; MIXING THE DRIED MIXTURE WITH ONE OF THE MIM BINDER SYSTEMS; AND ADDING THE METAL IN POWDER FORM TO THE MIXTURE GRADUALLY WHILE MIXING TO FORM THE FEEDSTOCK.
column15: FAIZ AHMAD;;ALI SAMER MUHSAN

column12: AN IMPROVED WHEELBARROW
column13: ACCORDING TO THE PRESENT INVENTION, THERE IS PROVIDED AN IMPROVED POWER ASSISTED WHEELBARROW IN WHICH AN ASSISTING FORCE IS EFFECTIVELY APPLIED TO THE WHEEL PORTION TO REDUCE MANUAL LABOR. SPECIFICALLY, THE PRESENT INVENTION PROVIDES A POWER ASSISTED WHEELBARROW HAVING A DC ELECTRIC MOTOR TO DRIVE THE WHEEL BY WAY OF A SPROCKET AND CHAIN, SAID POWER ASSISTED WHEELBARROW COMPRISING OF A REINFORCED BIN, A WHEEL CARRIED AT A CENTER OF A LOWER PORTION OF THE REINFORCED BIN, A PAIR OF RIGHT AND LEFT HANDLES RESPECTIVELY EXTENDING BACKWARD FROM TWO SIDES OF THE TRAY FRAME, A BATTERY MOUNTED ON THE FRAME OF THE BIN, AN ELECTRICAL MOTOR AT THE LOWER PORTION OF THE BIN, A PAIR OF HANDLE SHAFTS FIXED ON THE REAR END PORTIONS OF THE HANDLES AND EXTENDING BACKWARD, AND A PRESSURE SENSITIVE THUMB SWITCH ON THE RIGHT HANDLE THAT ACTIVATES THE ELECTRIC MOTOR.

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR DUAL MODEL-BASED EARLY PREDICTION OF HEART DISEASE FOR INDIAN TYPE-2 DIABETES MELLITUS PATIENTS
column13: The present invention generally relates to a system and method for dual model-based early prediction of heart disease for Indian type-2 diabetes mellitus patients. The first model is a full model which tested all of the collected variables, whereas the second model is a partial model and it consisted of selected variables. The patients are included in the system sample if they experienced angiography, left ventricular hypertrophy, left anterior hemiblock, myocardial infarction, right bundle branch block, left bundle branch block, left ventricular diastolic dysfunction, angina, coronary artery bypass grafting and ischemic cardiomyopathy within the follow up time period of 5 years. column12: METHOD OF THERMAL MANAGEMENT OF PORTABLE ELECTRONIC ELEMENT USING CARBON NANO TUBE METAL NANOCOMPOSITE
column13: THE PRESENT INVENTION DISCLOSES A METHOD OF FABRICATING MULTI WALLED CARBON NANO TUBULES WITH CU MATRIX NANOCOMPOSITES BY USING METAL INJECTION MOLDING TECHNIQUE TO PROVIDE A BETTER THERMAL CONDUCTOR. THE THERMAL CONDUCTOR ALSO PROVIDES ISOTROPIC SHRINKAGE IN THREE DIMENSIONS BECAUSE OF THE SHAPE. HIGHER THERMAL CONDUCTIVITY LEADS TO THE BETTER DISSIPATION OF THE HEAT FROM THE HEAT SOURCE AND LEADS TO BETTER AND FASTER COOLING; AND ISOTROPIC SHRINKAGE PROVIDES DURABILITY. column12: MINERAL BASED INTUMESCENT FIRE RETARDANT COATING COMPOSITION, AND METHOD OF FORMING AND TESTING THE COATING
column13: The present invention provides a mineral based fire retardant coating composition, a method of forming the coating and a method of testing the coating. The mineral based fire retardant coating composition comprising ammonium polyphosphate (APP) as acid source; expandable graphite (EG) as carbon source; melamine (MEL) as blowing agent; boric acid as additives and bisphenol A (BPA) and polyamide amine as curing agent; and inorganic fillers as performance enhancing components.

column12: METAL INJECTION MOLDED 316L STAINLESS STEEL FOR BIO AND DENTAL IMPLANTS
column13: The method of producing and composition of 316L stainless steel with enhanced and corrosion resistance and mechanical properties for medical implantation. The stainless steel powder is prepared in predetermined composition before mixing with plastic binder which is then produced by metal injection molding (MIM) and further processed by plastic binder removal. The stainless steel powder chemical composition comprises of carbon, silicon, manganese, phosphorus, sulfur, nickel, chromium, molybdenum and copper in predetermined formulation. The plastic binder composition comprises paraffin wax, polypropylene and stearic acid in predetermined composition.
column15: FAIZ AHMAD;;M RAFI RAZA;;M AFFIAN OMAR

column12: HYBRID FIBER COMPOSITE DRILLING
column13: A method for (100) analyzing influence of drilling parameters in a hybrid fiber composite comprising the steps of (S110) selecting at least two stepped structure designed fiber composite having a first thickness, (S120) comparing drilling parameters of the at least two fiber composites of the first thickness with a degrading parameter, (S130) selecting at least two stepped structure designed fiber composite having a second thickness, (S140) comparing drilling parameters of the at least two fiber composites of the second thickness with the degrading parameter, and (S150) comparing the at least two stepped structure designed fiber composite of the first thickness with the fiber composite of the second thickness to analyze the influence of drilling parameters. Most Illustrated: Fig. 1
column15: MOHD AZUWAN BIN MAOINSER;;FAIZ AHMAD;;SAFIAN BIN SHARIFF

column12: A METHOD OF PREPARING AN IRON-NICKEL SOFT MAGNETIC ALLOY HAVING HIGH MAGNETIC PERFORMANCE
column13: The present invention relates to a method (100) of preparing an iron-nickel (Fe-Ni) soft magnetic alloy, which comprises the steps of blending Fe and Ni powders to obtain a blended powder mixture; preparing a binder; preparing a feedstock by mixing the blended powder mixture and the prepared binder; molding the feedstock to obtain a molded body via powder injection molding; debinding the binder from the molded body via solvent debinding and subsequent thermal debinding; and sintering the molded body to obtain the Fe-Ni soft magnetic alloy. Specifically, the sintering step includes a pre-sintering stage, sintering stage, controlled cooling stage and furnace cooling stage. Further, the controlled cooling stage is configured to control grain size of the feedstock, cool the molded body at a predetermined cooling rate and cooling temperature range, and to hold the molded body under a predetermined dwelling time. [Fig. 1]
column14: INSTITUTE OF TECH PETRONAS SDN BHD

column12: A WOOL FIBRE REINFORCED EPOXY BASED INTUMESCENT COATING
column13: The present invention relates to a wool fibre reinforced epoxy based intumescent coating formulation comprising of three new formulations which were compared to Chartex 7, a commercial intumescent coating that was found to take longer to harden and dry naturally in ambient condition. Each formulation comprising and each formulation comprises:APP (Clariant) /PER (MERCK) /MEL at 3:1:1 weight ratio, boric acid, talc, clay, fumed SiO2, titanium dioxide alumina trihydrate (ATH), alumina, sodium carbonate, 1gram of fibre mainly glass wool fibre, Rockwool fibre and ceramic wool fibre. The formulation also includes Mustard oil, epoxy liquid, and hardener, wherein epoxy:hardener is 2:1. The invention also relates to a method for making the wool fibre reinforced epoxy based intumescent coating formulation, and a method for protecting a substrate from elevated temperature or fire by using said formulation.
column15: FAIZ AHMAD;;NORLAILI BINTI AMIR;;PUTERI SRI MELOR MEGAT YUSOFF

column12: SEMI-AUTOMATIC FERTILISING DEVICE
column13: ABSTRACT SEMI-AUTOMATIC FERTILISING DEVICE The present innovation provides a semi-automatic fertilising device which is detachably connected to a movable vehicle, which includes a first container (1) and a second container (2), wherein the first container (1) having a size relatively bigger and is located at a location relatively higher than the second container (2) measured from ground level, the first container (1) and the second container (2) are connected by way of a conduit which enables fertilizers to flow from the first container (1) to the second container (2), a means (4) to control and manoeuvre the device, a fuel releasing means (5) and a braking means (6), whereby, the first container (1) will first be loaded with fertilisers and once the fertilisers reach a predetermined level at the first container (1), the fertilisers will load unto the second container (2) by way of a gravity force for application of fertilisers by the operator. The most illustrative figure: Figure 1

column12: SEGMENTED HANDLE ASSEMBLY FOR AGRICULTURAL TOOLS
column13: THE PRESENT INVENTION PROVIDES A SEGMENTED HANDLE ASSEMBLY (1) PREFERABLY USED IN CONJUNCTION WITH FARMING/AGRICULTURAL TOOLS (2), THAT COMPRISES OF A PLURALITY INDIVIDUAL SEGMENTS (3) OF PREDEFINED LENGTHS WHEREBY EACH INDIVIDUAL SEGMENT (3) THAT MAKE UP THE HANDLE (1), HAVE AT ONE END (9) A CYLINDRICAL CAVITY THAT FORMS A FEMALE CONNECTOR (5) THAT IS FURTHER THREADED BY A HELICAL THREAD AND AT THE OTHER SYMMETRICALLY OPPOSING END (6) A COMPLEMENTARILY THREADED MALE CONNECTOR (6). THE ENTIRE HANDLE ASSEMBLY (1) IS ASSEMBLED BY MEANS OF SCREWING EACH OF THE PLURALITY OF SEGMENTS (3). THE FARMING/AGRICULTURAL TOOL (2) ITSELF IS ATTACHED TO THE ASSEMBLED HANDLE (1) IN A SIMILAR MANNER. THE ENTIRE ASSEMBLY (THE COMPLETE HANDLE ASSEMBLY (1) AND THE FARMING/AGRICULTURAL TOOL (2)) IS LOCKED AGAINST DISASSEMBLY AFTER A COMPLETE INITIAL ASSEMBLY BY MEANS OF BOLTING WITH THE AID OF SCREWS VIA A BORE-HOLE (10) AND PERFORATION (7) COMBINATION THAT ARE LOCATED ON THE MALE (6) AND FEMALE CONNECTORS (7) OF THE PLURALITY OF HANDLE SEGMENTS (3). THE SCREWS ARE SECURED TRANSVERSELY TO THE LONGITUDINAL ORIENTATION OF THE HANDLE ASSEMBLY (1).
